Key Match Events: The Mavericks passed out 33 assists in the 119-99 victory over Chicago, a season best.
The Mavericks played faster and the ball was whizzing around the court, leading to fewer half-court sets.
Kyrie Irving and Luka Dončić were instrumental in the ball movement strategy.
Dwight Powell stepped in at backup center with Dereck Lively II out and provided solid minutes.
O-Max Prosper gave Naji Marshall and Klay Thompson some rest periods.
Naji Marshall had eight points, two steals, and the Mavericks were plus-18 during his 21 minutes on the floor.
The Mavericks corrected a rebounding disadvantage in the second half, giving the Bulls just five second-chance points.
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Kidd praised the ball movement and contributions from multiple players.
Kyrie Irving emphasized the importance of consistency in their share-the-wealth strategy.
Jason Kidd highlighted Naji Marshall's versatility and efficiency in both starting and bench roles.
Others: The Mavericks were missing three rotation players, including starter P.J. Washington.
The depth on the front line is going to be tested with Lively, Washington, and Kleber out.
